content:
Heather Fleming said
how can I enable access for less secure apps in Mozilla Thunderbird. I'm hoping this will solve my sign in problems

Google have completely withdrawn less secure apps some 12 months ago. You must now use oauth authentication for google.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I suggest you offer the developers your feedback. connect.mozilla.org/

Use of old version is really not a good choice. Others might give you procedures to revert to an older version, but I will not because it will cause issues going forward. Not the least of which is being prompted to update every little while.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Hi, Probably something changed at your e-mail provider. Please first search this site for similar problem by entering the name of it and then if you don't find a solution provide more derails such as provider and how you authenticate with it.
creator: shopov.bogomil

content: If this is an Exchange network with IMAP and SMTP enabled, it should work with the authentication method set to OAuth2. Remove the passwords from Saved Passwords in Settings, change the authentication for incoming and outgoing, restart TB, enter the account password in the OAuth window to allow access. Not sure about Exchange, but most MS-type accounts copy sent messages to Sent automatically, so uncheck 'Place a copy in' in Account Settings, Copies & Folders, and subscribe the Sent and any other folders by right-clicking the account in the Folder Pane, Subscribe...
creator: sfhowes

content: I presume you have two smtp servers which differ only in the User Name field (email address), but is each account pointing to the correct server? Select an account in the left pane of Account Settings, then look at Outgoing Server (SMTP) in the right pane. Click Edit SMTP server... to inspect the settings.
creator: sfhowes
